q1 ex01.title: Does the code output Hello World!?

q2 ex02.title:
Did your peer write text = 'Marvin'?
(Single or double quotes is fine)

q3 ex03.title: For each string that your peer displayed using string methods, give 1 point.

q5 ex05.title: Does the code output the car exceeded the speed limit?

q6 ex06.title: If the output matches the example output, give 1 point. If your peer is able to output Pecos without using names[4], give 1 point.

q7 ex07.title: Ask your peer how they were able to achieve the output. For each matching output and correct explanation in every line, give 1 point.

q8 ex01.title: Ask your peer to explain the method they used. Let's change a few variables, set name = Joe , dog = Snoopy , shoes = 5 . Run the code, does it output Joe's dog Snoopy ate 5 pairs of shoes.

q1 ex01.title: Set speed = 60 and run the code, output should not say over the speed limit. Set speed = 61, output should say over the speed limit. If both conditions are met, select yes.

q2 ex02.title: Run my_function(). If the code outputs Hi Marvin!, select yes.

q3 ex03.title:
Run the below code block:
say_hi('Toto')
say_hi('Fifi')

If the output matches below, select yes.
Hi Toto!
Hi Fifi!

q4 ex04.title: Run print(calculate(15,'/',5)), the code should output 3. Run again with your own set of tests including addition, subtraction and multiplication. If everything works as expected, select yes.

q5 ex05.title:
Run print(check_string('Hello World!'), check_string('The yes string'), check_string('Three four five')).

If the output matches below, select yes.
No!
Yes!
No!

q6 ex06.title: Does the output match the example output? Does the code match the code snippet? If so, select yes.

q7 ex07.title: Check if the output matches the example output. Add Egypt and Zambia to the list, the output should now also include Come and visit Egypt and Come and visit Zambia. If all checks have passed, select yes.

q8 ex08.title: Run the code multiple times, is the output random?

q9 bonus01.title: Does the code display the current time correctly?

q1 ex01.title: Has the bot been added into the server?

q2 ex02.title: If the bot is online when the script is run. (+1pt) If your peer's bot prints a login message onto the repl.it console (+1pt) Can they explain how they did it? (+1pt)

q3 ex03.title: Did your peer manage to encapsulate their bot token inside a repl.it secret? (+1pt) Can they explain how they did it? (+1pt)

q4 ex04.title: Is the bot able to send the required message? (+1pt) How did they do it? (+1pt)

q5 ex05.title: Is the bot able to greet you using your Discord username?

q6 bonus01.title: Is your peer's bot able to greet you using your server nickname? (+1pt) Can they explain how they did it? (+1pt)

q1 ex01.title: Only tick 'yes' if all the objects are satisfied AND they can explain their code in their own words.

q2 ex02.title: Is the bot able to repeat your message? (+1pt) How did they do it? (+1pt)

q3 ex03.title: Is the bot able to repeat your message and delete your command? (+1pt) How did they do it? (+1pt)

q4 ex04.title: Is the bot able to play rock paper scissors? (+1pt) Ensure the bot is not hardcoded (+1pt)

q5 ex04.title: Is the bot able to detect who the winner is?

q6 ex05.title: Does the bot have a user manual?

q1 ex01.title: Is the bot able to send a random emoji using the command $emoji?

q2 ex02.title: Is the bot able to send a random emoji in an embed message form using the command $emoji_embed?

q3 ex03.title: Is the bot able to send a GIF using the command $gif?

q4 ex04.title: Is the bot able to send an image and a short description using the command $intro?

q5 ex05.title: Is the bot able to send an image using the command $img?

q6 ex06.title:
Is the bot able to react to the message with a tick and a random emoji using the command $react?
(Give 1 point if the bot reacts with either only a tick or a random emoji)
(Give 2 points if the bot reacts with both a tick and a random emoji)

q1 ex01.title:
Section 1: Print the key-value pairs as shown in the example output.
Section 2: List all the available keys in the database.
Section 3: Delete a key and print the updated list.
(Give 1 point for each section)

q2 ex02.title:
Section 1: Add one element to fruit.
Section 2: Add two elements to dessert.
Section 3: Delete any one element from dessert.
Section 4: List all keys and values in the database.
(Give 1 point for each section)

q3 ex03.title:
Section 1: Add a new key to the database using an if-else statement.
Section 2: Add Good Luck as the value for the key.
Section 3: Output the key-value pair.
(Give 1 point for each section)

q4 ex04.title:
Is the bot able to add a new message to the database using the command $new [your message here]?
(If the message was successfully added, the bot should say New encouraging message added. as per given example)

q5 ex05.title:
Is the bot able to list all messages stored in the database using the command $list?
(Select no if the bot's message contains ObservedList)

q6 ex06.title:
Is the bot able to delete a specific message based on its index from the database using the command $delete [index of message]?
(If the message was successfully deleted, the bot should say Encouraging message deleted. as per given example)

q7 ex07.title:
Is the bot able to delete a specific message based on its index from the database, and display the updated list of messages using the command $del_list? [index of message]
(Give 1 point for delete or list function)
(Give 2 points for both but with ObservedList problem)
(Give 3 points if the output matches given example)

q1 ex01.title: Is the bot able to scrape the first paragraph from the website using the command $scrape?

q2 ex02.title: Is the bot able to scrape the correct table row from the website using the command $programming?

q3 ex02.title:
How many elements is the bot able to scrape from the table using the command $programming?
(Give 1 point for each element)

q4 ex03.title: Is the bot able to scrape a Currency (e.g. USD) and its Exchange Rate from the website using the command $currency?

q5 ex04.title:
Is the bot able to scrape the Job Title, Company Name and Salary from the website?
(Give 1 point for each element)

q6 ex04.title:
Section 1: Is the bot able to scrape and compile the 1st and 2nd job's info from the website using command $job?
(Give 1 point for each job info)
Section 2: Is your peer's bot able to send the scraped job list in an embed message form using the command $job?
(Give 1 point for embed message)

q7 bonus01.title:
Section 1: Is the bot able to scrape the movie title (1 point) and storyline (1 point) from the website.
Section 2: Is the bot able to display an error message when no movie title was passed as an argument to the command $movie [your movie title] (1 point)

q1 ex01.title:
Is the bot able to return its IPv4 address using the command $ip?
(Verify that the bot sends an API request)

q2 ex02.title:
Is the bot able to return its geographical location using the command $iploc?
(Verify that the bot sends 2 API requests)

q3 ex03.title:
Is the bot able to output your peer's account information? (1 point)
Did the bot send an API request? (1 point)
Is the API token set in an environment variable? (1 point)
